rx.operators

Class NotificationLite<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • rx.operators.NotificationLite<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - 

    public final class NotificationLite<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    For use in internal operators that need something like materialize and dematerialize wholly within the implementation of the operator but don't want to incur the allocation cost of actually creating Notification objects for every onNext and onComplete. An object is allocated inside NotificationLite.error(Throwable) to wrap the Throwable but this shouldn't effect performance because exceptions should be exceptionally rare. It's implemented as a singleton to maintain some semblance of type safety that is completely non-existent.

    • Method Detail

      • instance

        public static <T> NotificationLite<T> instance()

      • next

        public java.lang.Object next(T t)
        Creates a lite onNext notification for the value passed in without doing any allocation. Can be unwrapped and sent with the NotificationLite.accept(rx.Observer<? super T>, java.lang.Object) method.
        Parameters:
        t -
        Returns:
        the value or a null token

      • completed

        public java.lang.Object completed()
        Creates a lite onComplete notification without doing any allocation. Can be unwrapped and sent with the NotificationLite.accept(rx.Observer<? super T>, java.lang.Object) method.
        Returns:
        the completion token

      • error

        public java.lang.Object error(java.lang.Throwable e)
        Create a lite onError notification. This call does new up an object to wrap the Throwable but since there should only be one of these the performance impact should be small. Can be unwrapped and sent with the NotificationLite.accept(rx.Observer<? super T>, java.lang.Object) method.
        Parameters:
        e -
        Returns:
        an object encapsulating the exception

      • accept

        public void accept(Observer<? super T> o,
          java.lang.Object n)
        Unwraps the lite notification and calls the appropriate method on the Observer.
        Parameters:
        o - the Observer to call onNext, onCompleted or onError.
        n -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the notification is null.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the Observer is null.

      • kind

        public Notification.Kind kind(java.lang.Object n)
        If there is custom logic that isn't as simple as call the right method on an Observer then this method can be used to get the Notification.Kind
        Parameters:
        n -
        Returns:
        the kind of the raw object

      • getValue

        public T getValue(java.lang.Object n)
        returns value passed in NotificationLite.next(Object) method call. Bad things happen if you call this the onComplete or onError notification type. For performance you are expected to use this when it is appropriate.
        Parameters:
        n -
        Returns:
        the unwrapped value, which can be null

      • getError

        public java.lang.Throwable getError(java.lang.Object n)
        returns Throwable passed in NotificationLite.error(Throwable) method call. Bad things happen if you call this the onComplete or onNext notification type. For performance you are expected to use this when it is appropriate.
        Parameters:
        n -
        Returns:
        The Throwable wrapped inside n
